titles: A warning for married women: being an example of Mrs. Jane Reynolds ... who having pledged her troth to a seaman was afterwards married to a carpenter, and at last carried away by a spirit, the manner how shall be recited. To a west-country tune, call'd, The fair maid of Bristol: or, John True, &c.
notes: Imperfect: faded, with loss of text.
Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
